Question.Subject: If my landlord has Direct TV/AT&T can I get Time Warner Cable internet?
Question.Content: So basically, the house I'm renting a room in has DirecTV cable and AT&T for an internet service provider. But, I want to get Time Warner Cable internet in my room. Would this be at all possible? Thanks for any help! What I mean is, is it possible to have the two companies working the same household? The landlord I know won't have a problem with the plan.
Question.ChosenAnswer: If your landlord says yes, you can. Otherwise, you'll have to use a wireless internet.

Answer.Content: If your landlord says yes, you can. Otherwise, you'll have to use a wireless internet.

Check your lease and ask the landlord. We can't give you more advice than that.
Hope that helps.
